title: How is it possible for a B.Tech (ECE) student to do a B.Ed? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hello, Yes, you can do B.Ed course after B.tech. In fact many students doing. Guideline for B.Ed admission :- The qualification required for BEd is a candidate should have a graduation degree from a recognized university with at least 50% marks. There is no age limit for this course. So, if you fulfill the above criteria then you can take the admission in BEd. For Expert Guidance - Guidance for B.Ed admission. You can choose subjects in B.Ed according to your stream , depends on subjects you have studied in your graduation course. Majorly subjects chosen by B.Tech students are :- Computer science, Physics , Mathematics , Biology (*only for B.tech in bio- tech), Even you can choose language subjects as one of your subject out of Hindi or English. Further, you can even go for M.Ed., diplomas, Ph.D in this field for higher preferences. Best wishes!! Hope this helps! NOTE :- please “UPVOTE” my answer . Thanks in advance.

Yes it is possible. If you want to pursue your career in teaching field, bed will be useful for you. Subjects like mathematics, physics and chemistry are usually choosed by those teachers who go for teaching after BTECh. So if you want to teach in good schools then minimum eligibility criteria there is having b-ed degree. You can apply for various private colleges or universities for B-ed degree or you can appear for B-ED entrance exams and can have admissions in government colleges.
